definition: (slang) novice/greenhorn/fool/idiot/abbr. for 小白臉|小白脸[xiao3 bai2 lian3], pretty boy

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
little white mouse (esp. laboratory animal)/fig. guinea pig, i.e. human participant in experiment
(bird species of China) house swift (Apus nipalensis)
erhua variant of 小白臉|小白脸[xiao3 bai2 lian3]
(bird species of China) lesser white-fronted goose (Anser erythropus)

sentences.english: White recognized the voice: It came from one of their rescuers.
sentences.chinese: 小白聽出了那個聲音，那是她們的一位救命恩人。

sentences.english: Long with a loose top small white pompon .
sentences.chinese: 頂端長着一個鬆散的小白絨球。

sentences.english: Snowflake gave her a friendly and grateful look, and then went leaping joyfully after the other goats.
sentences.chinese: 小白友好感激地看了看她，然後高興的跑向羊羣。

sentences.english: It was the "Little White Donkey" incident that pushed many readers over the edge.
sentences.chinese: 是“小白驢”事件把許多讀者真逼急了。

sentences.english: "White little" and I are losing the fight.
" she lifts her little white paw upward, eyes glistening in anticipation.
sentences.chinese: 它都會把它的小白爪子擡起來，眼睛閃閃發亮。

sentences.english: A golden retriever has come to the rescue of a trio of baby white tigers, who were abandoned by their mother.
sentences.chinese: 一隻金毛尋回犬救了三隻被媽媽拋棄的小白老虎的命。

definition: (pet name for a baby or small child)

to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly

eldest of father's younger brothers/uncle (term used to address a man about the age of one's father)
